profile.name: Nusrat Jahan Riya
profile.title: PhD Student & Graduate Teaching Assistant
profile.institution: University of Texas at San Antonio
profile.bio: I am a PhD student and Graduate Teaching Assistant in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Texas at San Antonio. My research focuses on Explainable AI, Trustworthy Machine Learning, and Medical Image Analysis.
profile.background: Before joining UTSA, I worked as a Senior Software Engineer in Bangladesh, where I gained extensive experience in developing scalable software solutions. I received my B.Sc. in Computer Science and Engineering from Khulna University of Engineering & Technology.

publications.title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Early Detection of Dengue Using CBC Data
publications.authors: Nusrat Jahan Riya; Mritunjoy Chakraborty; Riasat Khan
publications.abstract: Dengue fever is a tropical mosquito-transmitted disease spread through the Aedes mosquito, where the human body works as the primary host. Each year, densely populated countries such as Bangladesh, Thailand, and India, particularly in the Southeast Asian region, experience the majority of dengue outbreaks worldwide.
